item.description:
It has been a rough few months.

I am going to have some time off in August, so at the Meet Up Monthly
Meeting on July 19 we decided that we will take a weekend trip to
Salem during my time off.

If there is still interest in going in October, then we might also go in
October.
If there is no interest in October, then I will cancel that trip.

We will be staying at the Comfort Inn in Danvers.
(978) 777-1700
If you have AAA, then you can get a discount through them.
You have to make your own reservation.
I will be meeting Maribeth and her group at the hotel later Friday night.

There will be later updates and reminders of the Salem Trip.

http://www.bestmaps.c...

www.bestmaps.com/

We will park either in front of the Salem Mall or in the
Parking lot between the Mall and the Visitors Center.

We will try to fit in three or four attractions for the day.

We might need to break off into different groups
Depending on who wants to go where.

We will arraign to meet each other at the Visitors Center
at a certain time later in the afternoon.

Some of us might stay late enough to go on a Ghost Tour.

Please let me know if you have any comments or questions.

A lot of us need a break with everything that has been
happening. This is my break for a couple of days.

Directions that I will be taking.

(This depends on traffic, if I - 95 is busy then I will take back roads
to I - 91.)

I - 95 N to I - 91 N
to I - 84 to
Mass Pike 90
to Exit 22
I-495
to Exit 24 to
(back roads to avoid the highways)
Rt 20 Main Street
(Massachusetts has hard to see signs so becare
when trying to look for Rts.)
To Rt 60 Linden Street
to Rt 1
to Rt 114
To Hotel

Rt 114 goes into Salem.
I avoid Rt 114 in October because of the traffic going into Salem.
I do not know if it will have traffic in August?

Mike B
Organizer
item.how_to_find_us: I will have my purple backpack with me.
item.name: Coffee Talk's Salem Trip on August 14 to16
